SEARCH
Package antcolony.entities

Class AntPhysics

java.lang.Object
antcolony.entities.AntPhysics
public class AntPhysics extends Object
Physics engine for the ants.

This class implements the Reynolds locomotion model (Steering Behaviors). It manages position, velocity, and acceleration through Euler integration, allowing for organic and smooth movements instead of robotic linear motion.

      Distance at which the sensors (antennae) are from the ant's center.

    • sensorAngle

      public float sensorAngle
      Aperture angle for the lateral sensors (in radians). Set to PI/3 (60 degrees).

  • Constructor Details

    • AntPhysics

      public AntPhysics(processing.core.PApplet p, float x, float y)
      Physics Constructor. Initializes vectors and ensures the ant starts pointing upwards.
      Parameters:
      p - Reference to PApplet.
      x - Initial X position.
      y - Initial Y position.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates physics (Euler Integration). 1. Adds Acceleration to Velocity. 2. Limits Velocity. 3. Adds Velocity to Position. 4. Resets Acceleration.

    • applySteering

      public void applySteering(processing.core.PVector desired)
      Applies a steering force. Reynolds formula: Steering = Desired - Velocity.
      Parameters:
      desired - The vector representing where the ant "wants" to go.

    • moveForward

      public void moveForward()
      Applies a force to continue moving in the current direction.

    • turn

      public void turn(float angle)
      Applies a force to turn in a specific direction relative to the current one.
      Parameters:
      angle - The angle in radians to rotate.

    • seek

      public void seek(processing.core.PVector target)
      Pursues a specific target.
      Parameters:
      target - The position of the target (food, pheromone, etc.).

    • wander

      public void wander()
      Adds random movement (noise) to simulate natural behavior.

    • getSensorPos

      public processing.core.PVector getSensorPos(float angle)
      Calculates the absolute position of a sensor (antenna).
      Parameters:
      angle - The sensor's angle relative to the ant's front (0 = front).
      Returns:
      The (x,y) position where the sensor is "smelling".

    • checkEdges

      public void checkEdges(processing.core.PApplet p, float leftW, float rightW, float surfaceY)
      Keeps the ant within simulation boundaries. Makes the ant "bounce" (invert velocity) if it hits the walls.
      Parameters:
      p - Reference to PApplet (for width/height).
      leftW - Left sidebar boundary.
      rightW - Right sidebar boundary.
      surfaceY - Top boundary (ground level).
